document.title: 2020 New Jersey Student Learning Performance Expectations

934CFA91A4A844F6BDFBE701208496AF.description:
Explain that individuals who abuse alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs can get
help.

AB8D8375C429403EB20BB5AC7EB8FF86.description:
Recognize that some people may have difficulty controlling their use of alcohol,
tobacco, and other drugs.

E78237536A674378B72FD2100FE7002E.description: Explain effects of tobacco use on personal hygiene, health, and safety.

FAEA6A05AE684AD2A829792BD47AF9D1.description: Identify ways in which drugs, including some medicines, can be harmful.

5A6C50F7DFB4481DA7B05D73A48C084F.description:
Explain what medicines are, how they are used, and the importance of utilizing
medications properly.

E4BD5F7E4BC546699DD886A127B855E7.description:
Explain strategies and develop skills to prevent the spread of communicable
diseases and health conditions (e.g., Lyme disease, influenza, cardiovascular diseases).

36A8A20C74E24784979F351319B7E96D.description:
Demonstrate personal hygiene and the use of necessary and appropriate
health-enhancing behaviors that can keep a person healthy (e.g., precautions to avoid illnesses,
handle food hygienically, brush teeth, regular physical activity, adequate sleep, appropriate
dress for various weather conditions).

97CE5E8A7A2D434C8ADAE26E2F2CC3D8.description:
Explain the consequences on a person’s health if he or she does not have
adequate food and a clean environment.

BEB6300714024336A2BA2766E91E85BA.description:
Identify trusted adults, including family members, caregivers, and school staff,
that you can talk to about situations which may be uncomfortable or dangerous (e.g., bullying,
teasing, child sexual abuse).

356BAB70137E4A44ABB3E61B5255F380.description:
Identify behaviors that would be considered child abuse (e.g., emotional, physical,
sexual).

5D589886141C42CD939F2C25BAC4A970.description:
Demonstrate how to communicate personal boundaries and show respect for
someone else’s personal boundaries including friends and family.

B7F9B23FD7F942FB9905D0C144D58499.description: Define bodily autonomy and personal boundaries.

5889A72D3FFC47FC99011A2E05A32342.description:
Develop an awareness of warning symbols and their meaning (e.g., red light, stop
sign, poison symbol).

BC4D04A28447409A89133BC99B8180EA.description:
Recognize and demonstrate safety strategies to prevent injuries at home, school, in
the community (e.g., traffic safety, bicycle/scooter safety, fire safety, poison safety, accident
prevention).

267ACBD4695642D085274ADEBD8B60BE.description:
Discuss healthy and safe choices both indoors and outdoors (e.g., using equipment,
wearing bike helmets, vehicle, water, weather safety).

5B7521C3522744039A8942848F4F8A40.description:
Demonstrate personal habits and behaviors that contribute to keeping oneself and
others healthy and the environment clean and safe.

B7FB0C1B572D4177AD4084EC847D0476.description: Differentiate between healthy and unhealthy eating habits.

171A53DC1CC849B0863C851E52970EFF.description: Explain why some foods are healthier to eat than others.

CBCF50950A2742E79CD3FAAECE6F5EE4.description: Explore different types of foods and food groups.

34E2830A60764624B9EE6619FD0359A6.description: Identify physical activities available outside of school that are in the community.

E4EFF0A06456491C85BFA829A7A45874.description:
Explore the body's range of motion through participating in flexibility and
breathing exercises (e.g., stretching, mindfulness, yoga).

9C1C8D306E164FA683C2E1FE06E783FE.description:
Perform movement skills that involve controlling and adapting posture and
balance, to successfully negotiate different environments (e.g., mats, turf fields, grass fields,
hard surfaces, gym floors, sand, water, snow) during physical activity.

12E5E47221694DFDB8B41CC6246AA9A0.description:
Express one's feeling and emotions when involved in movement and physical
activities to increase positive behaviors.

1F41C61E1AD542A1BEF23AD99C06B878.description:
Demonstrate strategies and skills that enable team and group members to achieve
goals.

6754A1D054C4457B9EFBC92BA2F0B016.description:
Engage in moderate to vigorous age-appropriate physical movement and physical
activities that promote movement (e.g., games, challenges, team building).

E444A141F3CE4D4CAD860577E31F540B.description: Explore how to move different body parts in a controlled manner.

D62B113DD12A459FBC06DD5CEFF1F830.description:
Explain the benefits of regular physical activity and what it means to be physically
fit in relation to personal health. (e.g., healthy heart, strong bones, increased energy, strong
muscles).

6961148F53D744DCBD4261F3C2301DAB.description: Explain the difference between offense and defense.

542D891384A14B96BE39E2AB4D59A329.description:
Demonstrate kindness towards self and others during physical activity to create a
safe and caring environment.

1D8C9FD72E0841C8837E16F88ECB2D6E.description:
Execute appropriate behaviors and etiquette while participating in and viewing
activities, games, sports, and other events to contribute to a safe environment.

5A62FCDC84C94B0BA5AA97810AE03860.description: Adjust and correct movements and skill in response to feedback.

448F28DD97184A76AF3DA166D6657D98.description: Differentiate manipulative movements (e.g., throwing, catching, dribbling).

8B17D48FEBE2473DBB3720F65F61FA57.description:
Demonstrate manipulative movements (e.g., throwing, catching, dribbling,
running, kicking) while moving in personal and general space, time, directions, pathways and
ranges.

73BA8A3675FE479DA3188D765F1F5A71.description:
Differentiate non-locomotor and locomotor movements as well transferring body
weight (e.g., stretching, bending, twisting, curling).

50EC21C252314B88B79D0A3B0EF3A60A.description:
Perform a combination of sequences of locomotor movements and rhythmic
activities (e.g., walking, balancing, hoping, skipping, running).

C6121EDB73EB4392AA0E05D0B830B2E0.description:
Identify individuals who can assist with expressing one’s feelings (e.g., family
members, teachers, counselors, medical professionals)

434181D2F738465F8D335D73876F973A.description:
Identify situations that might result in individuals feeling sad, angry, frustrated,
or scared.

0EFB4FD4E5B34633B84B86215891C974.description:
Individuals face a variety of situations that
may result in different type of feelings and
learning how to talk about their feelings is
important.

DDA6B71754BA4EEFABD2F3583BECF9FE.description:
Describe how climate change affects the health of individuals, plants and
animals.

A1119615705644AB816E248746E21A99.description: Demonstrate how to dial and text 911 in case of an emergency.

C43C9D8CF02D4542B230FC1C2D0DC4E0.description: Determine where to access home, school and community health professionals

BB7A0CF7558C4DF0BA6996D5AAADA1B3.description:
Identify community professionals and school personnel who address health
emergencies and provide reliable health information to us.

EA75C6388D744E489E9B24EDF163C7E5.description:
People in the community work to keep us
safe.

3F60C67718E0486484066B186EDEB0E3.description: Define bullying and teasing and explain why they are wrong and harmful.

37130729E8DB41F1BD3B48013E48E0E2.description:
Demonstrate healthy ways to respond to disagreements or conflicts with others
(e.g., leave, talk to trusted adults, tell a sibling or peer).

192FD26E1F134A4B9D267542EDC561F0.description:
Conflicts between people occur, and there are
effective ways to resolve them.

1A4CFC89066446E9BB19C35ACE937627.description: Explain healthy ways for friends to express feelings for and to one another

06679689B26F4D0180188ADFE055BF9F.description:
Communication is the basis for strengthening
relationships and resolving conflict between
people.

9C2706B6DC644D4EAFAB592F1B7F65E1.description: Determine the factors that contribute to healthy relationships.

560890281CD943DEB430394C5246FAA2.description: Identify basic social needs of all people.

293B5B9068DE492D8788415BF807AF09.description:
People have relationships with others in the
local community and beyond.

36BD74D59FA24AE694D68E8D0B45CA55.description: Determine the factors that contribute to healthy relationships within a family.

10FF256400104F6AA1F80A51F357A7E7.description:
Describe different kinds of families locally, nationally and globally and note
similarities in the ways in which they keep their children safe.

160BC2497E804D78A8BDC4889B85DEFE.description:
Families shape the way we think about our
bodies, our health and our behaviors.

1DFA59982C4542439DE2680632B5191B.description:
Discuss the range of ways people express their gender and how gender-role
stereotypes may limit behavior.

81597778E1B3469E8D6FF191DDD8A109.description:
Discuss how individuals make their own choices about how to express
themselves.

61BD3BA3A9D8413CA23F5A17BCBF1109.description:
Every individual has unique skills and
qualities, which can include the activities they
enjoy such as how they may dress, their
mannerisms, things they like to do.

CB0777CD9743433DA43AFF9C8B32F1E4.description: Explain healthy ways of coping with stressful situations.

F38E4878E6FC49998669BBD2704D404E.description: Demonstrate strategies for managing one's own emotions, thoughts and behaviors.

C21D8862786D40CA90D2DC6A7F469765.description:
There are different ways that individuals
handle stress, and some are healthier than
others.

5BDCD05618CC404AA60314CF1E5281AC.description:
Demonstrate self-control in a variety of settings (e.g., classrooms, playgrounds,
special programs).

8D1D1DFC0A0B41FC8DE89960419063FA.description: Identify what it means to be responsible and list personal responsibilities.

754ABBF7D38D435EBED936F9862C8EC3.description:
Explain the meaning of character and how it is reflected in the thoughts, feelings
and actions of oneself and others.

B29311631D91457DAE1CDAFD37ED0750.description:
Many factors influence how we think about
ourselves and others.

C8C6DCA8E49A446182AB746B72E2D0AA.description:
Explain the ways in which parents may care for their offspring (e.g., animals,
people, fish).

9ABCB0CAC2514275A413973C041A6149.description:
All living things may have the capacity to
reproduce

CE81D960B28040C8879FE223B1AAD3B6.description: List medically accurate names for body parts, including the genitals.

39CE4606D96C4A51A3AE8846CC45013B.description:
Use correct terminology to identify body parts and explain how body parts work
together to support wellness.

57C139F0BB504570A40DB5D06F9B3C4F.description:
Explain what being “well” means and identify self-care practices that support
wellness.

D7662104F5114DA28F33303AF3801CC3.description:
Develop an awareness of healthy habits (e.g., wash hands, cough in arm, brush
teeth).

722CBB1371A946C6B5719A39038F1CD4.description:
Personal hygiene and self-help skills
promote healthy habits.

2A51E8ECA14746BEB91C607B664CD2A7.description: Explore how activity helps all human bodies stay healthy.

448F363A304746A59FCF895FA0CC5982.description:
Individuals enjoy different activities and
grow at different rates.
